feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:57PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak And Kobuk River Valleys... The Kobuk and Noatak Valleys had 1-3 inches of rain earlier this week, with another 1-3 inches expected there through Friday. This will cause sharp rises on all rivers in the Noatak and Kobuk Basins through this weekend. At this time large rivers such as the Kobuk and Noatak are not expected to flood, but smaller rivers
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:57PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED SURF TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY... South winds of 25 to 40 mph over the West Coast of Alaska today are causing elevated surf from the Bering Strait south to the Yukon Delta. Wave action will combine with storm surge and be the greatest along south facing coastlines, with anticipated storm surge
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:37PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 12:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by elevated river levels will continue into the weekend. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Saturday.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 5:05PM MST until August 25 at 7:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN GILA AND SOUTHERN COCONINO COUNTIES... At 503 PM MST, Thunderstorms earlier near Pine deposited between an inch and a inch and a half in the area. Run off from heavy rainfall will impact Tonto Natural Bridge State Park and Flowing Springs through early evening.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 5:03PM MST until August 25 at 6:15PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL NAVAJO AND WESTERN APACHE COUNTIES... At 501 PM MST, Heavy rain from earlier thunderstorms deposited between 1 and 2 inches of rainfall from Keams Canyon to Indian Wells. While the rainfall has ended...run off will continue through early evening across local washes and drainages as well as low water

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 25 at 9:04AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY FRIDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence on Friday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 25 at 6:12PM MDT until August 25 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTHERN MEAGHER COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 615 PM MDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However, small hail is still possible with this thunderstorm.
